snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin said Edward J. Snowden would not receive political asylum in Russia unless he stopped publishing classified documents that hurt the interests of the United States.
abstract: Pres Vladimir V Putin of Russia, in attempt to maintain good relationship with United States while not appearing to bend to their will, says that Edward J Snowden can receive political asylum in Russia as long as he stops publishing classified documents that hurt the interests of the US.

byline.original: By ANDREW ROTH and ELLEN BARRY

lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin said Edward J. Snowden would not receive political asylum in Russia unless he stopped publishing classified documents that hurt the interests of the United States.

headline.main: Snowden Seeks Asylum in Russia, Putting Kremlin on the Spot
headline.print_headline: Snowden Seeks Asylum in Russia, Putting Kremlin on the Spot
